flowDiagram.title: System Configuration Flow
flowDiagram.subtitle: This diagram shows how different modules connect and the recommended configuration order. Click any node to navigate to that module.

description.title: Configuration Flow Explained:
description.step1: Create Customers first - they are the foundation of the billing system
description.step2: Set up Billing Accounts from your cloud provider and link them to customers
description.step3: Create Projects under billing accounts, then assign to customers
description.step4: Configure Product Groups to categorize SKUs, and Pricing Lists with discount rules
description.step5: Import cost data via Cost Imports - this requires projects and product groups
description.step6: Run Invoice Runs to generate invoices using costs, pricing, and credits
description.step7: Review generated invoices, reconcile with provider data, and record payments

quickStart.step6: Import cost data and run invoice batches

roles.title: User Roles Explained
roles.superAdmin: Full system access with all permissions. Can manage all customers and system settings.
roles.admin: Administrative access within assigned customer scopes. Can manage customers, invoices, and configurations.
roles.finance: Finance team access for billing operations. Can view invoices, record payments, and manage credits.
roles.viewer: Read-only access to view data within assigned scopes. Cannot make any changes.

tips.title: Tips & Best Practices
tips.tip1: Always lock invoices after review to prevent accidental changes
tips.tip2: Use product groups to organize billing items for clearer customer invoices
tips.tip3: Assign customer scopes to non-admin users to limit their data access
tips.tip4: Check audit logs regularly to monitor system changes
